• The apparatus includes rake systems with needles that supplement the angle of the yarn carriers, ensuring parallelism and allowing for controlled overlap of return courses.

• The invention relates to weft insertion in a multiple-color air jet loom.
• Different weft threads require different weft carrying forces for insertion.
• The invention provides methods and apparatuses to adjust the weft carrying force according to the selected weft thread.
• This is achieved by either ejecting air under different pressures or for different intervals of time.
• The invention aims to improve weft insertion stability and reduce air consumption.

* The invention provides a process for spinning bast fibres, involving twice health-preserving bast fibres, opening, cleaning, carding, drawing into strips, and spinning into yarn.
* The process reduces end breakage rate, for example, to 150-200 times per hour for each machine when the yarn is 12 s in fineness.
* The invention also provides a process for blended spinning bast fibres and other fibres, with similar steps and benefits.

* The invention relates to a sensing roll for use in a nip press, which includes strategically-placed sensors to measure pressure at various cross-directional positions along the roll.
* The invention aims to detect and remove the effects of rotational variability from the nip pressure profile of the covered roll, allowing for a more accurate display of the nip pressure profile.

* The invention is an apparatus for supporting an electrical cord of an electrical appliance and holding an article, such as a spray starch can or a beverage container.
* The apparatus includes a releasable clamp for securing it to a work surface, a flexible cord support, and a detachable article holder.
* The cord support has a first rod with a cord receiving end, a second rod with a foot pivotably received by a brace on the clamp, and a resilient spring section joining the first and second rods.
* The article holder has a lower hoop, support bars, an upper hoop with tangs, and vertical supports, and can be detachably mounted to the clamp.

• The buttonhole controlling device of the invention includes a foot pad attachable to a presser bar and a travelling assembly with an initial position defined by oppositely acting springs.
• The travelling assembly moves with the work fed during sewing and includes a slidable member positionable by a button for which a buttonhole is to be sewn.
• The slidable member carries a tab to actuate a tripping lever on the machine during movement of the assembly, limiting the length of a buttonhole formed with the buttonhole device to that suitable for the button inserted in the travelling assembly.
• An adjustable stop mounted on the travelling assembly engages the tripping lever to terminate the formation of a buttonhole, allowing an operator to precisely define the closure point and prevent open or overlapping stitches.
• The device is designed to work with different types of materials, compensating for varying degrees of slippage by adjusting the stop position.
• The machine sews top bar and left leg stitches with the tripping lever in a forward position, and bottom bar and right leg stitches with the tripping lever in a rearward position.

* The fabric treatment apparatus includes a conveyor with an endless sieve belt for transporting the textile web along a horizontal path.
* A liquid applicator applies the liquid to the web at a first station along the path, and a suction device removes the liquid at a second station downstream of the first station.
* The apparatus includes a dwell stretch between the applicator and the suction device for conducting the textile web in a spread-out condition and in a single layer through at least one dwell loop.
* The dwell stretch can be an air pass with vertically extending loops or a meander path around a sieve drum.

• The dry cleaner machine has an air flow system that brings ambient air into the access opening whenever the door is opened, preventing users from encountering solvent vapor fumes.
• The machine has a separate intake fan and duct for this purpose, with a normally closed valve isolating the system from solvent vapors during normal operation.

* The invention provides a method and apparatus for forming fine continuous filaments, particularly useful for creating nonwoven webs, using a combination of eductive and non-eductive spinning systems.
* The process involves spinning filaments into a quench chamber, drawing them through a continuous two-dimensional slot across the machine width, and collecting them on a gas pervious conveyor belt collector to form a web.
* The system uses a single source of air for both quenching and drawing, which simplifies the process and reduces energy consumption compared to conventional systems.

• The sewing machine 1 is provided with an additional receiver 96 on the left surface 17 of the pillar 12.
• The receiver 96 is configured to detect an ultrasonic wave transmitted from the ultrasonic pen 92.
• The CPU 61 calculates the specified coordinates E based on the detection timings T2 of the receivers 94, 95, and 96.
• The CPU 61 does not acquire the transmission timing T1 of the ultrasonic wave and does not use the transmission timing T1 when calculating the specified coordinates E.

* The invention provides a preparation for cellulosic fabric materials comprising wool particles or wool powder as a carrier for functional additives, with the wool particles being of macrofibril size or below.
* The preparation can enhance the durability of functional enhancements of a cellulosic fabric material, such as ultraviolet protection, anti-bacterial properties, and moisture management.
* The functional additives can include anti-UV agents like zinc oxide or titanium oxide, anti-bacterial agents like nano-silver, zinc oxide, or titanium oxide, and ultrafine bamboo powder for improved moisture management.
* The preparation is applied onto the cellulosic fabric material using methods such as printing, padding, or foam application, and can also enhance the wrinkle recovery of the fabric.

• The automatic quilting machine uses two separate computers: one for controlling the sewing machine functions and another for controlling the quilting table movement.
• The machine can duplicate individualized patterns through a computer aided design program that converts hand-drawn patterns into machine-readable language.

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a method of making a two-sided nonwoven fabric with a durable three-dimensional image.
* The fabric is formed from a first precursor web comprising a first fibrous matrix and a second precursor web comprising a second fibrous matrix.
* A fluid-pervious support layer or scrim is interposed between the first and second precursor webs to act as a fiber distribution control layer.
* The precursor webs are hydroentangled on a moveable imaging surface having a three-dimensional image transfer device to form the three-dimensionally imaged fabric.
* The first and second fibrous matrices may comprise staple length fibers or substantially continuous filaments.
* The first and second fibrous matrices may be dissimilar, with the fibrous matrix having the lower fiber modulus coming in contact with the three-dimensional imaging transfer device.
* The fabric may include apertures extending partially or entirely through one or more of the component layers.
* Subsequent to hydroentanglement, the fabric may be subjected to post-entanglement treatments, such as application of a polymeric binder composition, mechanical compacting, application of surfactant or electrostatic compositions.
* The fabric may be used in various applications, such as disposable absorbent hygiene articles, medical gauze, wipes, protective wear, and protective covers.
</summary>

* The invention is a device for feeding a strip of material into a sewing machine and sewing it onto a cut of fabric.
* The device includes a stop that can be moved into the feed path of the strip and retracted after being contacted by the strip.
* The movement of the stop controls a signal transmitter for a setting means for the stop, which is an air cylinder that moves the stop substantially perpendicularly to the feed motion of the workpiece.

<summary>
* The invention provides a method for connecting two tape-shaped knit pieces in a knitting process.
* A flat knitting machine with at least a pair of front and rear needle beds, either or both of which are movable, is used.
* Two tape-shaped knit pieces are knitted on different ranges of the needle beds with a boundary between them.
* The final course loops of both knit pieces are overlaid and bound off gradually.
* This process is repeated until the two pieces are connected.
* The end parts of both knit fabrics are joined, preventing the final end portion from loosening the stitch.
* The knitting machine used has multiple knitting needles disposed on needle beds laid out in a V-form.
* The rear needle bed is formed movably in the lateral direction.
* The knitting machine is controlled by a computer following a designed knitting pattern.
* The invention can be applied to various parts requiring linked tape- or rope-shaped portions, such as sweater collars, tanktop neck ropes, and apron neck ropes.</summary>

• The invention relates to a flexible traction element, a production line, and a method for embedding stranded cables in a flexible thermoplastic material.
• The traction element comprises at least one stranded cable with a core strand sheathed by a flexible thermoplastic plastics material layer.
• The production line includes a reel for unwinding the stranded cables, a device for precise orientation, a heater, an extruder for co-extrusion, a cooling trough, a roller store, a cutting device, and a storage roller.
• The extruder has a thread guide for the stranded cables and at least one matrix, which can be adjusted with and in relation to one another individually, in a plane P angled with respect to the cable plane.
• The method involves degreasing and/or pretreating the stranded cables to improve adhesion, preheating them to a temperature close to the melting point of the flexible thermoplastic plastics material, and sheathing them in the extruder with the liquefied plastics material.

• The invention relates to a lockstitch sewing machine with a rotary hook arrangement.
• The bobbin housing has a triangular shoulder with front and rear side faces on the loop cast-off side.
• A spring rod extends between a front cam and a rear cam, hindering the bobbin housing from co-rotating with the hook body.
• A capsule release device gives the bobbin housing a rotational impulse counter to the hook rotation direction.
• The needle thread loop moves unhindered around the bobbin housing and through gaps created by the shoulder and the capsule release device.
• The rotary hook arrangement ensures a jerk-free and low-friction motion of the needle thread loop.

• Electrospinning methods were demonstrated using four-component inks with liquid silanes, polymers, accelerants, and solvents.
• Three-component inks without accelerants were also used for comparison.
• Inks were characterized by post-deposition treatments including thermal treatment and laser exposure.
• Electrospun deposits were characterized using scanning electron microscopy and Raman spectroscopy.
• Four-component inks produced stable, porous wires with amorphous silicon phase.
• Three-component inks without accelerants produced unstable deposits with amorphous silicon phase.
• Five-component inks with solid phase components were also demonstrated.
• Electrospun deposits from five-component inks were characterized and showed crystalline silicon phase after laser treatment.
• Electrospun deposits were used to make anodes in electrochemical cells with initial capacities of 3400 mAh/g.

<summary>
* The invention provides an arrangement for controlling thread tension in a spool creel with multiple spool holders.
* Each spool holder has a brake rotor and an adjustable braking element coupled to it.
* A tensioning lever biases the braking element and has a roller engaged by the threads.
* The tensioning lever occupies an angular position dependent on thread tension and weight.
* A biasing arrangement activated by fluid pressure is connected to the tensioning lever.
* The biasing arrangement influences the tensioning lever to alter thread tension.
* The biasing arrangement is preferably a piston/cylinder assembly.
* The tensioning lever subtends an angle A to the horizontal plane of more than 45°.
* The biasing arrangement subtends an angle B to the horizontal plane of less than 45°.
* The biasing arrangement may also operate a brake shoe on a further braking surface.
</summary>

• The sewing machine detector uses light shielding discs to detect needle position and sewing machine speed.
• The detector includes first, second, and third light shielding discs, each with a light shielding area.
• The first disc detects sewing machine speed and needle UP position, the second disc detects needle DOWN position, and the third disc detects thread trimmer timing position.
• The discs are mounted coaxially on a shaft connected to the sewing machine shaft.
• The optical fiber supporter includes linear optical fiber fixing holes and reflecting portions opposite the ends of the light sending and receiving optical fibers.
• Light is transmitted from the light sending optical fibers, reflected by the first reflecting portions, passes through the light shielding discs, is reflected by the second reflecting portions, and enters the light receiving optical fibers.
• The light shielding areas of the discs are disposed between the first and second reflecting portions.
• The power indicating optical fiber runs from the module section to the detecting section for power indication.
• The second and third light shielding discs are rotatably mounted to the shaft for angle adjustment.
• The indicator arrows of the second and third light shielding discs are printed in different colors to facilitate angle reading.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a process for continuous production of viscose rayon yarns with a high degree of whiteness.
* The process involves partial coagulation and drawing of the yarn, followed by completion of coagulation, washing under specific conditions, drying, and optionally finishing.
* The completion of coagulation can be achieved through various methods, such as passing time, acid treatment, or a combination of both.
* The washing step is critical and must be carried out using water with a pH between 4.0 and 5.5, free from excessive amounts of Ca2+ and Mg2+ ions.
* The washing reduces the amounts of total sulfur, elemental sulfur, sulfides, iron, zinc, and lead on the yarn to specific levels.
* The resulting yarn has a degree of white not lower than 45, eliminating the need for additional bleaching or desulphuration treatments.
</summary>

• The invention relates to a system for deaerating pulp after oxygen bleaching to facilitate washing.
• The system includes a deaeration tank with a specific design to optimize deaeration.
• The deaeration tank has an inlet pipe, an outlet, and a tangential swirl inducing filtrate inlet pipe.
• The inlet pipe is located above the surface of the slurry and allows the pulp to splash against the side wall of the tank.
• The outlet is located in the bottom plate of the tank and is aligned with the inlet pipe.
• The filtrate inlet pipe is located between the bottom of the tank and the surface of the slurry, and induces a swirl in the slurry.
• The deaeration tank may be closed and built to withstand pressures of ±1 atmosphere if oxygen or steam is being recovered.
• The height of the slurry in the tank is controlled by a sensor that operates a valve in the outlet pipe.
• The filtrate from the washer after the oxygen bleach is used as the swirling fluid in the deaeration tank.

<summary>
* The invention provides biomimetic tendon-reinforced (BTR) composite structures with improved properties, including high out-plane stiffness and strength-to-weight ratio.
* The basic structure comprises stuffer members, tendon elements, and panels, with the stuffer members and tendon elements arranged in various configurations, including parallel, radial, and curved alignments.
* The panels may be flat, convex, concave, or have complex shapes, and may be equidistant or vary in distance from one another.
* The stuffer members and tendon elements may be embedded in a matrix material, and the tendon elements may be tied or bonded at their crossing points to form joints.
</summary>

• The invention is a load-limiting device for dissipating energy during dynamic events in structures.
• The device is designed to undergo plastic deformation to limit loads transmitted to other parts of the structure.
• It can be easily removed and replaced after plastic deformation.
• The device can be used in various structural applications, including buildings, bridges, and vehicles.

• The bedroom cabinet is composed of an outer casing and an inner casing, providing mechanical strength and a flat external appearance.
• A clearance between the outer and inner casings forms boxes for accommodating electric devices or user's belongings without narrowing the dwelling area.
• The outer casing is assembled by placing an upper outer casing on a lower outer casing, with flanges on each casing brought into abutment with each other.
• The inner casing is composed of six panels connected and fixed by seals, with the front panel having an opening for an exit.
• In a second embodiment, spacer members with vent grooves are interposed between the outer casings and the inner casing to form a clearance for natural ventilation and sound-proofing.

* The invention provides a portable guard rail support for constructing temporary safety barriers at construction sites.
* The guard rail support consists of a base plate, an upright column, rail supporting brackets, a retaining flange, an angular brace, and a safety tie-off ring.

* The invention uses pulsed power electrohydraulic and electromagnetic methods to stimulate crude oil reservoirs and enhance production.
* The pulsed power device generates a rapid release of electrical energy, creating a high-power output that can be harnessed in various industrial, chemical, or medical applications.
* In the electrohydraulic (EH) mode, the pulse is used to create a plasma channel in water, generating high pressures and temperatures that expand outward from the discharge point.
* In the electromagnetic (EM) mode, the coil generates a short-lived but extremely intense magnetic field.
* The invention combines direct EH acoustic vibrations with electromagnetically-induced high-frequency acoustic vibrations to stimulate oil flow and increase production.
* The EM-induced vibrations are generated by the electromagnetic pulse traveling at the speed of light across the reservoir, inducing a coupled acoustic vibration at very high frequencies in geologic materials like quartz.
* The direct acoustic pulse travels through the reservoir at the velocity of sound, assisting the EM-induced vibrations in stimulating the reservoir.
* Effective acoustic stimulation of oil-bearing reservoirs requires higher frequencies than direct acoustic methods can generate and support at great distances from the stimulation source.
* The invention extends the effective range of stimulation by using a multi-level discharge device that allows sequential firing of several sources in one well in a time sequence optimized to allow continuous electromagnetic-coupled stimulation of a large reservoir volume while the electrohydraulic acoustic pulse travels further from the pulse well than it could before a single source electromagnetic vibration would decay.

• The disclosure presents a splice for extending the length of a soil reinforcing element used in Mechanically Stabilized Earth (MSE) structures.
• The splice consists of two wave plates, each with transverse protrusions to receive and seat corresponding transverse wires of the soil reinforcing element and a grid-strip.
• The wave plates are coupled together using connective devices, such as bolts and nuts, which also clamp down on the longitudinal wires of the soil reinforcing element and grid-strip, preventing lateral movement.
• The splice allows for multiple grid-strips to be added to a single soil reinforcing element, creating a composite soil reinforcing element with a desired length.
• The transverse wires of the soil reinforcing element and grid-strip are prevented from longitudinal escape by being seated in respective transverse protrusions of the wave plates.
• The splice enables the use of shorter soil reinforcing elements, which are easier to manufacture and transport, while still achieving the required reinforcing distance from the vertical facing.

* The invention relates to a plow blade design that provides fluid passage and ejection points using basic manufacturing processes.
* The blade can be tailored for specific job requirements by adjusting the length of the fluid tube, the number and location of leading edge sections, and the use of a manifold with adjustable nozzles.

* The MCL StuccoRite® Cavity Wall Cavity System is a masonry cladding system that meets performance requirements of the Building Code, including structural integrity, durability, spread of fire, and external moisture resistance.
* The system comprises proprietary plaster reinforced with pre-papered hot dipped galvanized zinc steel wire mesh and other reinforcement to achieve a nominal thickness of 21 mm with a standard sponge or plastic float finish.
* The plaster is applied in three coats: a base coat, a levelling coat, and a top coat. The base coat encapsulates the pre-papered mesh reinforcement as well as additional reinforcement at corners and around joinery. The levelling and mesh coat contain further reinforcement in the form of fibreglass mesh.
* The final skim coat is sponge or plastic float finish.
* The mesh is fabricated from copper bearing cold drawn hot dipped galvanized zinc vertical face wires and horizontal back wires, electrically welded at all points of intersection. The zinc coating is not less than 27.9 g/m2.
* Reinforcement at all external corners is provided by uPVC Kwik corners, and at window and door openings by uPVC Kwik flanges.
* MCL Fibreglass Mesh is contained locally at certain openings in the base coat and continuously in the levelling and mesh coat. The mesh is alkali resistant and woven with a 4 mm×4 mm aperture weighing not less than 165 grams per square meter.
* The edges of the plaster are formed and supported by a number of uPVC mouldings, including the MCL Bottom J-Mould with Drip Edge and the MCL Window/Door head with Drip Edge, which also provide vermin proofing and allow for drainage and ventilation to the cavity. Movement is accommodated by providing physical breaks in the plaster using uPVC mouldings for the vertical movement control joint and with a uPVC window head moulding and Z flashing for the horizontal movement control joint.

* The safe has a valuables receiving chamber with a rectangular opening and inwardly extending ledges on opposing walls for a separate steel door.
* The door is inserted at an angle into a deeper groove while the other edge is pivoted toward a ledge, then laterally displaced until the latter edge is in abutment with the seat of the shallower groove.
* A lock assembly on the reverse side of the door has a latch bolt engaging a detent in one bar for prevention of lateral movement.
* Reinforcing bolts on both sides of the lock bolt prevent transmission of force to the lock mechanism in the event of forceful intrusion attempts.

* The invention relates to measuring fluid pressures in geological formations more accurately by isolating the pressure sensor in a borehole to the formation pressure at a desired depth.
* The method involves cementing a conduit with a filter at its bottom end in the borehole, clearing the conduit of cement grout, displacing the grout around the filter to create a fluid connection to the formation, and optionally fracturing the formation to improve connectivity.

• The jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints and the like having an expansion function comprises steps at the coaxially built traveling path ends with an expansion gap between, elastic members respectively mounted inside the steps, and a joint block mounted on the elastic members across the expansion gap.
• The joint block blocks up the expansion gap in a bridge girder joint while permitting an expansion gap function to be maintained, preventing tire fall-in and/or stuck-in situations for smooth vehicle traveling.
• The elastic members are mainly consisting of laminated rubber, hard to be deformed vertically and easy to be deformed horizontally in a soft manner, and are fitted to the joint block detachably by bolting or the like for easy maintenance.
• Supporting blocks may be mounted inside the steps with the joint block between to protect the traveling path ends from tire impingement and/or impact responses, and are fitted detachably to the intra-step traveling path side walls in close contact therewith with mounting bolts or the like to form a continuously extending traveling path surface.
• Intermediate joint blocks may be mounted inside the steps with the joint block between to decentralize the expansion gap in the traveling path joint into more than one expansion gap to make the size of each individual expansion gap smaller, so that the occurrence of tire fall-in and/or stuck-in situations may be prevented more surely for the achievement of the increased driving quality.

• The invention relates to an enclosed floor track system for use in a fluid treatment chamber.
• The system allows wheeled trucks to move into and out of the chamber without contaminating the sanitary environment.
• The track includes a wheel channel that is disposed above the fluid level on the floor by support legs.
• The wheel channel has opposed sidewalls, one of which extends upwardly more than the other.
• A cover plate is attached to the longer sidewall and horizontally overlies the top of the channel.
• The vertical space between the shorter sidewall and the cover plate accommodates the axle structure connecting the truck frame to the wheel.
• The cover plate may be connected to the longer sidewall by a hinge to facilitate cleaning of the channel.
• In another embodiment, the enclosed floor track is structured to accommodate trucks with downwardly depending struts supporting the wheel structure.
• The sidewalls of the wheel channel extend upwardly beyond the top of the wheel structure and include inflatable elastomer seals at the top edges.
• When inflated, the elastomer strips enclose around the hand truck wheel struts and prevent entry of the brine solution into the guide track.

* The lock device comprises an engaging member (lock plate) and an engaged member (lock pin) for locking a boom to a main body.
* The engaging member is supported by a support pin inserted into a slot and guided by a guide member.
* The engaging member has a hook part, a forward-slanted surface, and a slot. It also has a rearward-slanted surface and a rear upper surface for maintaining the lock position.
* The guide member is disposed above the support pin and does not become horizontal while the boom is rotated between its highest and lowest positions.

• The invention provides a swimming pool vacuum cleaner with an adjustable vacuum head to regulate suction efficiency during cleaning.
• The adjustment is made by conveniently located mechanisms on the top of the suction head, regulating the spacing between the lower surface of the central, suction portion and the pool bottom.
• The adjustment mechanisms precisely regulate the position of the inboard rollers, which in turn adjusts the platform's central, suction portion.
• The adjustment is achieved by tightening or loosening wing nuts connected to elongated connectors, which move the axles of the inboard rollers within vertical slots.
• The invention also includes a kit for retrofitting existing pool cleaning devices with the adjustment mechanism, involving minimal changes to the existing device.

<summary>
* The present invention relates to an apparatus for retrieving wear bushings from oil and gas wells.
* The apparatus consists of a sub-unit and a retriever section.
* The sub-unit has a mandrel with a longitudinal bore, an upper collar section, and a threadably removable lower collar section.
* The retriever section is slidably movable between the end collars of the sub-unit and is adapted with protruding members for engaging with a wear bushing.
* The mandrel section of the sub-unit has grooved sections on both sides for slidably engaging with insertion members on the retriever unit, allowing vertical movement but preventing rotational movement.
* The retriever section can be mounted onto the mandrel and connected onto drill pipe, allowing vertical play to prevent damage to the retriever unit or the wear bushing.
* The wear bushing retriever apparatus can be threadably engaged between any two sections of drill pipe without retrieving the drill bit from the hole.
* The wear bushing retriever apparatus is easily removable and installable for quickly removing the wear bushing during the drilling operation.
* An embodiment of the retriever apparatus can retrieve the bushing by threadably engaging the bushing.
* The apparatus solves the problems in the present state of the art by allowing the retriever section to have vertical play while preventing rotational movement, preventing damage to the wear bushing or the retriever unit.
</summary>

<summary>
* The tool has an outer body with a lower end attached to a stuck object or fish and an upper end.
* Within the outer body and extending uphole from the upper end is the mandrel connected to the surface through a string.
* The mandrel has a passage in fluid communication with the passage in the string so that pressure can be delivered from the surface to lateral ports.
* Ports lead to an annular space with which there is communication to a piston that is attached to the mandrel.
* Pressure in the space pushes down the piston and with it the mandrel at the same time displacing fluid from a chamber through an opening.
* The tool has a modular design that allows for the selection of the number of pistons to match the power required for the particular work string or anticipated downhole conditions.
* The mandrel has a lower end that marks the end of the passage and a nearby shoulder on which a drop-in plug can be landed to close off the passage.
* The plug is preferably retrievable and has a fishing neck so that it can be captured and returned to the surface with known tools.
* The plug also has a seal to help close off the passage and build pressure in it.
* The tool has a dump valve disposed annularly about the central passage so that cycling the tool does not cause it to be slammed against a seat.
</summary>

* The retaining wall is made of precast concrete in two discrete, modular parts: a face panel with an integral counterfort and a base.
* The face panel has at least two counterforts spaced apart evenly from ends of the face, extending perpendicularly from the face panel and having a flat bottom.
* The base is a generally solid, rectangular or trapezoidal shaped platform set on grade, with at least one opening sized to accept the downward-extending rebar ends from the counterfort.
* The connection between the first module and second module is made by inserting an end of a piece of rebar of one module into an opening in the other module and then sealing the connection with grout.
* The retaining wall can be customized with a vehicle impact barrier formed and cast-in-place on top of the wall or behind the wall.

<summary>
* The present invention provides an improved down hole heating system for oil and gas wells to increase flow by addressing two primary shortcomings of conventional approaches: improper heat focus and inadequate protection of electrical components.
* The system focuses heat on the production zone of the formation to heat oil and paraffin in situ and allow it to flow to the well bore for pumping.
* The system includes heat insulating packers and stainless steel collars to contain heat within the desired zone and prevent heat loss up the well bore and through the production tubing.
* The heating unit has impenetrably shielded electrical connections to prevent physical and chemical attack and electrical shorting caused by unit invasion by down hole fluids.
* The electrical connections are shielded using a cement block of high temperature cement encased in a steel fitting assembly, with a CONAX BUFFALO sealing fitting to transition leads from outside to inside the heating unit.
* The method for use of the system involves installing the heating unit with shielded electrical connections and heat-retaining elements to properly focus heat on the producing formation, and may also be used by substituting cable for the down hole pipe during well treatments or maintenance.
</summary>

• The invention provides a downhole tool for installing and retrieving objects in wells, with a simple and efficient mechanism for connecting and disconnecting.
• The tool has an outer tubular body and an inner body structure that move telescopically to engage or disengage with the object.
• A catch mechanism with locking and unlocking positions controls the connection, using guide pins and spring-loaded recesses for selective latching and unlatching.
• The tool can be used for various service operations, including fishing for stuck or lost tools, and can be easily disconnected if necessary.

• The example embodiment relates to modular composed stave floors.
• The known stave floors have a thin sight substrate, which can deform or detach when sanded or rushed.
• The base substrate of known stave floors is composed of slung wood or triplay, joined by glue.
• The known stave floors have a short life and cannot be maintained.
• The example embodiment provides a method for manufacturing composed stave floors with improved durability and maintainability.
• The method includes providing a sight substrate with a thickness of at least 4 mm and a base substrate with a thickness of at least 12 mm.
• The base substrate and sight substrate are assembled together with glue and multidirectional holding means.
• The multidirectional holding means include dendrites, adhesion and horizontal reinforcement means, and adhesion and vertical reinforcement means.
• The example embodiment provides a composed stave floor with improved resistance to deformation and detachment.
• The example embodiment allows for corrective maintenance of the composed stave floor.

• The invention presents a brace for a ladder to improve its stability and prevent damage to work surfaces.
• The brace consists of an extension arm with a flange at one end and an opening at the other, a U-bolt, and a resilient pad assembly.
• The U-bolt secures the brace to the ladder's rung, while the resilient pad assembly provides non-slip gripping and broad contact area with the work surface.
• The brace can be adjusted to accommodate different ladder sizes and can be used on either side of the ladder.
• A clamp is used to secure the brace to the ladder's siderail, preventing any motion of the arm towards or away from the siderail.
• The brace allows the ladder to straddle corners without losing stability, as the pad assembly can pivot horizontally to contact opposite faces of a corner.

* The present invention relates to a collated nail strip formed with a debris-free plastic material for use in a fastener driving tool.
* The plastic material is an adhesive polymer, such as a polyolefin, a polyolefin blend, an epoxy, or the like, and is molded onto and adhered to the nails.
* The nails are arranged at an angle relative to the longitudinal direction of the strip, and the strip can be coiled for use in certain tools.
* The collation system includes upper and lower plastic moldings adhered to the nails, with the upper molding formed nearer to the head of the nail and the lower molding formed nearer to the tip of the nail.
* The lower molding is formed on the shank of the nail within the lower half and preferably within about ½ inch of the tip of the nail.
* The plastic molding can be formed having a taper to facilitate penetration into the substrate.

<summary>
* The nozzle for applying sealants comprises a bell or hood lower section and an injection button.
* The bell or hood lower section is coupled in a non-permanent manner to the injection button.
* The injection button has a particular design with channels and orifices for guiding the injection of the sealant.
* The nozzle is useful for encapsulating rivets or screws, particularly applicable in the aeronautical industry.
* The nozzle allows the user to apply sealant operations both manually and by automated sealant injection machines.
* The nozzle may be used in the aviation industry and the automotive, naval, railway and robotics industries.
* The nozzle comprises a main elongated hollow body having a truncated cone shape.
* The nozzle comprises a connecting hollow round section with a threaded exterior surface for coupling to a sealant container cartridge or injection machine.
* The nozzle comprises a bell or hood shaped section physically connected to the second end of the main elongated body.
* The nozzle comprises an injection button connected to the peripheral annular flanged section of the bell-shaped section.
</summary>

• The invention relates to a position sensor that modifies an unconditioned sensing signal from a transducer using an error correction signal to provide a conditioned sensing signal.
• The error correction signal is generated by an error correction generator that includes a comparator, a controller, and a signal processor.
• The comparator determines the value of the conditioned sensing signal, the controller provides first and second timing signals based on the value, and the signal processor generates the error correction signal using the timing signals.
• The error correction generator determines and eliminates strong static signals and error signals that do not deliver information about the position of an object being sensed, saving energy.
• The sensor constantly compares the sensor output to a desired minimum value and generates a correction signal that is subtracted from the offset and error signal to deliver a sensor output that is close to the desired minimum value.
• The sensor is connected to external circuitry through a current-to-voltage converter resistor and draws a minimum of current upon startup and initial calibration.

• The invention presents a desmodromic valve actuation system for internal combustion engines, eliminating the need for springs.
• The system uses a rotating cam and translating means to interact with a second controllable actuating means, allowing for variable valve displacement.
• The rotating cam has a grooved track that displaces a translating means, which in turn reciprocates along a line of action.
• The translating means is attached to an assembly containing a rotatable link with a slot that presents an angle to the line of action, controlling the valve's movement.
• The link is rotated by an adjustable member with a slot parallel to the line of action, allowing a pin to slide along the line of action and secure the angular position of the slot.
• The adjustable slide must move normal to the line of action in a housing affixed to the engine block, and is controlled by an actuator with position information.
• The cam groove curvatures are designed to provide proper rise and fall along with dwell time for effective valve control.
• The system allows for computer control of each valve, enabling operation of any set of pistons and variable valve displacement for efficient gasoline consumption and enhanced engine performance.

* Light member includes a housing with a top side and a bottom side, and a lighting control region on the bottom side with first and second control channels and a neutral channel.
* First and second light-emitting modules are releasably coupled to the lighting control region and emit different colors of light.
* Each module includes electrical connectors that couple to the control channels and the neutral channel to provide power to the module.
* Switches on the housing control the first and second control channels independently.
* Modules can be added or removed from the lighting control region as desired.
* Light member can be used with an aquarium or underneath a cabinet.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a cooled flow deflection apparatus for a fluid-flow machine operating at high temperatures.
* The apparatus is a hollow casting with holders in the form of rails for inserting separating walls.
* The separating walls are flat strips made of metallic or heat-resistant non-metallic material.
* They are inserted through the blade root or tip and secured by an integral material joint, preferably by soldering or welding.
* The separating walls can be straight or bent into a U-shape for deflection devices.
* The apparatus is a blade in a gas turbine, with cooling channels and separating walls extending essentially in the radial direction.
* For rotor blades, the integral material joint is arranged at the end of the separating walls close to the axis.
* The invention simplifies production, allows flexible matching to the application, and provides efficient cooling.
</summary>

* The system automatically or manually controls a fuel delivery system, such as a throttle valve, based on signals from an accelerator pedal and throttle position sensor.
* It uses a control unit that processes these signals to generate commands for a DC motor or stepper motor, which adjusts the throttle position for optimal vehicle performance.
* The system can switch between automatic and manual control, ensuring a smooth transition by matching the throttle position to the accelerator pedal's command before engaging the clutch for manual control.

• The invention provides a waste fuel burner that emits minimal particulate materials, operates with little slag or clinkers, and can burn wet wood with 70% moisture content.
• The burner is self-regulating, easy to control, and has fast response times to changes in load.
• It forms a conical pile of waste fuel with preheated underfire air percolating up through the pile for drying and gasification.
• Volatile gases driven off the pile are partially oxidized by additional combustion air introduced tangentially with a vigorous swirl in a primary combustion chamber.
• The amount of combustion air admitted to the primary chamber is maintained at less than stoichiometric proportions to keep the temperature lower than the melting point of the natural ash, dirt, or other inorganic substances in the fuel.
• The swirl air forces particulate matter out of the gas stream leaving the primary chamber.
• A flame holder in the throat of the primary chamber forces the gases out to the walls of the throat, causing entrained matter to centrifugally separate and fall back into the primary chamber.
• The volatile gases move around the flame holder into a secondary combustion chamber where secondary combustion air is introduced tangentially in an amount above stoichiometric proportions for complete combustion.
• The swirl air and secondary combustion air interact to maintain good separation of the particulate from the gas stream leaving the primary chamber.
• The burner can be coupled to any source of dirty particulate-laden combustible gas and effectively burn the gas to provide a source of useful heat and remove the particulate for meeting environmental emission standards.

* The invention provides an evaporative air conditioning system that separates the dry and wet sides of a heat exchanger to cool air without adding water vapor, using a major portion of recirculated working air from the load.
* The system uses an array of spaced, vertically directed hollow tubes for countercurrent flow of working air and water, with fresh air flowing externally across the tubes for cooling.

<summary>
* The fluid pump comprises two or more pump heads configured in series.
* Each pump head comprises a housing containing an impeller driven by a drive structure.
* The housing of each pump head comprises an inlet and at least two fluid conduits.
* Fluid flows from the housing into the fluid conduits, is combined into one fluid flow, and exits the pump head.
* The fluid flow from one pump head into another defines a fluid flow path between the pump heads.
* The drive structure passes through the inlet between the pump heads and commonly drives the impellers.
* The pump heads may be removably connected or formed in a unitary structure.
</summary>

• Engine 10 includes engine housing 11 defining multiple cylinders 20.
• Engine compression release brake 40 is provided for a portion of cylinders 20, less than all.
• Each cylinder 20 has piston 21 moving between retracted and advanced positions.
• Engine brake 40 is activated during piston 21's compression stroke for engine braking.
• Engine brake 40 opens exhaust valve 35 to vent compressed air from cylinder 20.
• Engine brake 40 includes electrical actuator 42, pilot valve member 46, and spool valve member 55.
• Piston 70 moves lash adjuster 73 to open exhaust valve actuator 37 for engine braking.
• Engine brake 40 is modular, allowing customers to choose desired braking horsepower.
• Engine 10 operates cylinders without engine brakes 40 in a typical power mode during engine braking.

• The invention relates to a mounting link between an engine structure and an attached structure like an auxiliary gearbox.
• The link assembly includes a male link, a female link, and a pin.
• The female link receives the male link, allowing translation and forming a radial interface that dampens translation.
• The pin releasably retains the male and female links.
• The male link is coupled to the engine or gearbox, and the female link is coupled to the other component.
• The radial interface provides coulomb damping to dissipate energy created by translation.
• The pin serves as a fusible link, shearing under extreme loads.
• The snap ring limits the relative travel of the male link within the female link.
• The use of the pin and radial interface damping obviates the need for all linkages to survive extreme loads.
• The pin can be replaced during maintenance following any shock sufficient to break it.

* The invention provides a lightweight point cap system with adjustable weight for perfect arrow balance.
* The point cap system reduces material and weight of the point or broadhead, making it suitable for slim graphite arrows.
* The invention also includes a balance pin whose weight can be adjusted to balance an arrow shaft, and a nock cap adaptor for attaching nocks to the end of an arrow shaft.

• The Small Arms Firing Effect Simulator (SAFES) is an electronic device that simulates the sound and flash of small arms fire for training purposes.
• It uses a low-cost plastic expendable housing a metal/oxidizer pyrotechnic, which is ignited electrically to produce sound and flash.
• The expendable is inserted into a firing unit that can be inserted into the weapon via the magazine breech, utilizing the weapon's ejection port for venting combustion.
• The electrical control circuit provides for automatic and semiautomatic fire, and interfaces with the weapon trigger and bolt.
• The circuit includes a bolt interface, trigger interface, oscillator control, oscillators, firing counter, firing decoder, firing control, firing sensors, and a MILES interface.
• The pyrotechnic charges are contained in a plastic expendable that resembles a magazine clip, enhancing the realism of the training experience.

• The air intake device comprises a tank with two interconnecting pipes to the intake passage, one with a larger cross-section and a valve, the other with a smaller cross-section.
• The valve is controlled by an actuator responsive to engine load conditions to improve engine performance by utilizing dynamic effects.
• The smaller pipe acts as a resonator to reduce intake noise.
• The valve is operated based on a map stored in a control circuit, considering engine speed and load.

• The invention is a two-part bracket assembly for mounting objects like speakers to poles or flat surfaces, consisting of a stationary bracket and an adjustable bracket.
• The adjustable bracket can be easily attached to the stationary bracket by one person, allowing for simple and secure mounting of heavy objects.

* The burner has a combustion chamber enclosed by an outer wall surrounding a fuel holder, with air flowing through the fuel holder to support initial combustion and around the fuel holder to support secondary combustion above the fuel holder.
* The burner has a shroud providing a second wall surrounding the outer wall, establishing a flow path for tertiary combustion air also impinging on the flame and fumes, and providing an external surface cool enough to avoid burns if casually contacted.
* The burner has legs holding the combustion chamber well above ground level, and a pivotally coupled ash pan. A perforate food grate is pivotally coupled to the burner, and is movable to a deployed position above the flame, and to a stowed position to the side of the combustion chamber and associated outer walls.
* Opposite the perforate food grate, a cover is pivotally coupled to the burner, enabling the combustion chamber to be closed to prevent inadvertent ingress of dropped items, inadvertent exposure of the user to heat and exhaust fumes, and to suppress escape of live embers.
* The burner has manual couplings for removably coupling modular heat utilizing appliances to the burner, the modular heat utilizing appliances including closed and open cookers, a food smoker, a space heater, and a pyrolyzer.

<summary>
* The invention aims to improve combustion efficiency and reduce housing structural failures by enhancing cooling in a rotary engine.
* It combines an ignition system with a cooling system to maintain efficient combustion while minimizing thermal distortion.
* The housing structure facilitates circumferential cooling flow while minimizing thermal distortion, particularly around spark plug bosses.
* The housing has a peripheral cooling circuit with separate flow paths for vapor release from spark plug bosses.
* The staggered arrangement of spark plug bosses promotes close in-line arrangement of spark plug terminals while improving heat transfer.
* The bosses are offset but symmetrically oppositely oriented about the centerplane of the flow and skewed with respect to it.
* Flow diverters or controllers between the spark plug bosses ensure a controlled flow regime and strengthen the housing structure.
* The staggered boss configuration increases the heat transfer coefficient by at least 20% compared to prior art capabilities.
</summary>

• The invention is a method to minimize flow disturbance caused by closing and reopening turbine control valves during periodic operational testing.
• It uses control valve positions as feedback to maintain constant total mass flow through parallel valves, thus keeping steam boiler pressure and turbine power constant.
• The method determines flow as a function of control valve position and compensates for flow changes due to valve closure and reopening.
• It uses a test compensation circuit that adjusts flow through parallel control valves to minimize flow disturbance during testing.
• The method reduces pressure excursion by 95% compared to not using flow compensation, as shown in a simulated turbine system.

• The invention is a mixing valve for combining fluids from two separate sources into one mixture.
• The valve has a valve body with a first inlet for a first fluid (soap solution) and a second inlet for a second fluid (water).
• The valve body also has an outlet for the mixture of the two fluids.
• The valve includes a spool valve disposed within the valve body to direct the fluids towards the outlet.
• The spool valve is adjustable to provide a mixture ranging from 0% first fluid, 100% second fluid to 100% first fluid, 0% second fluid.
• The valve body also includes a flow restricting device to reduce the flow rate of the first fluid.
• The spool valve is restrained from translational movement by a set screw and from rotational movement by stops on the valve body.

<summary>
* The method involves compressing gas to an excess pressure higher than the desired exit pressure, cooling it by heat exchange to a temperature above the exit temperature, and then expanding the gas to the desired exit pressure while simultaneously performing work in an expansion turbine.
* The compressor station includes at least one compressor for compressing gas, at least one heat exchanger for cooling compressed gas, valve-controlled pipelines for connecting the compressor and the heat exchanger to one another and to the gas pipeline, and an electronic control for controlling the compressor and the valves.
* The electronic control operates the compressor to compress the gas to an excess pressure substantially above the desired exit pressure, and an expanding unit is provided for expanding the compressed gas until the desired exit pressure is reached.
* The compressor station can be operated in two different modes: summer operation, where the gas is compressed in three stages to an excess pressure, cooled, and then expanded to the desired exit pressure; and winter operation, where the gas is compressed in two stages to the desired exit pressure and then cooled before being returned to the pipeline.
</summary>

<summary>
* The text describes a cooling fan mounting system that eliminates the need for fasteners.
* The system is used in applications where free convection cooling is insufficient, such as in computer towers.
* The cooling fan assembly includes a motor, fan blade, and a motor carrier with mounting legs.
* The panel to which the fan is mounted has recess portions with openings that correspond to the mounting legs.
* The mounting legs have resilient leg portions that snap into place in the panel's openings when the fan is rotated and pressed against the panel.
* The motor carrier also includes spring members that urge the motor carrier away from the panel, preventing it from becoming disengaged due to vibrations.
* The system is applicable in any application where forced air movement is relied upon for adequate cooling.
</summary>

* The invention provides kinematic mounts with damping features to protect instruments from damaging flight loads.
* The mounts incorporate passive energy dissipating mechanisms, such as viscoelastic materials, to reduce vibration transmission.
* The damping mechanisms are designed to be most effective at high frequencies, where suspension modal frequencies occur, and less effective at low frequencies, where thermal loads occur.
* The mounts can be arranged in various configurations, including a truss structure or a set of three mounts, and can be designed to provide approximately uncoupled suspension modes.

* The clutch unit uses separate piston and cylinder means for each set of clutch disc segments and clutch plates to apply full force and transmit maximum torque.
* The auxiliary oil supply maintains a pressure in the piston and cylinder means to positively retract the clutch plates from the clutch disc segments, reducing residual drag.
* The clutch discs are segmented to allow easy removal and replacement of individual segments without disassembling the entire mechanism.
* The unit provides improved cooling and torque control, and minimizes the deleterious effects of heat on the discs.

• The invention combines combustion and expansion cylinders to capture and reuse heat energy, potentially eliminating the need for a radiator.
• Water is injected into the expansion cylinders to create steam, which drives the pistons and further cools the exhaust gases.
• The use of multiple expansion cylinders allows for a greater surface area and volumetric displacement, enabling the system to capture a larger percentage of the useful energy generated by combustion.

• The invention provides a plate with a steel substrate and a precoat consisting of an intermetallic alloy layer topped by a metal alloy layer, where at least one precoated face has the metal alloy layer removed in an area at the periphery of the plate.
• The precoat is preferably an aluminum alloy or aluminum-based, and the metal alloy layer preferably comprises 8 to 11% of silicon, 2 to 4% of iron, with the remainder being aluminum and inevitable impurities.
• The width of the area from which the metal alloy layer has been removed is preferably between 0.2 and 2.2 mm, and can vary.
• The thickness of the intermetallic alloy layer is preferably between 3 and 10 micrometers.
• The area from which the metal alloy has been removed can be produced by brushing or using a laser beam.

<summary>
* The present invention is a remote control system for supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) enabling navigation and automatic operation of a mobile structure that extracts energy from severe weather patterns.
* The system optimizes efficiency by accounting for data from weather observations and sensors on the mobile structure, relating these data points to performance models for the mobile structure.
* The mobile structure can be a sailing or propelled vessel or barge, or any mobile buoyant energy recovery system.
* The algorithm optimizes efficiency by adjusting points of sail, rudder rotation, openness of turbine gates, and ballast draft through control outputs from the microprocessor system on-board the sailing vessel.
* The SCADA system includes computer servers that gather data through diverse means such as Global Position Satellite (GPS) systems, weather satellite systems, and various geographic and weather data resources.
* The SCADA computer servers run Human Machine Interface (HMI) secure software applications which communicate to microprocessor systems running client software with a Graphical User Interface (GUI) to allow remote humans to optionally interact and choose mission critical navigation plans.
* The system can navigate vessels for logistics-only purposes past weather patterns using just the path cost algorithm without weighing energy extraction yield factors into the cost of travel.
* The system can guide navigation of vessels for energy recovery or logistics purposes past physical objects by detecting, identifying, and avoiding them.
* The system can account for VPP modeling of the mobile structure when assigning weights that average over a path based on direction and length in a weighted anisotropic energy yield raster.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a rolling body guide cage produced from a ring element made of sheet metal with axial profiling and several rolling body guide structures.
* The ring element is composed of at least two flat material ring segments joined in succession in the circumferential direction.
* The ring segments are connected, preferably welded, to one another in a production step preceding the formation of the axial profiling.
* The flat material ring segments are placed in succession with one another in the circumferential direction and are welded along edge regions facing one another in engagement zones.
* The flat material ring segments are connected to one another in the region of the engagement zones across positively engaging joint contours forming an undercut geometry.
* The joint contours are configured such that the weld seams taper towards the ring element inner and outer circumferential edges with as obtuse an angle as possible.
* The flat material ring segments are preferably formed as 120° ring segments, requiring only three weld points for joining.
* The rolling body guide cage can be structured as a radial or axial bearing cage, in particular for groove and angular ball bearings.
* The rolling body guide cage can be composed of a first ring element and a structurally identical second ring element positioned in mirror-symmetry.
* The method for manufacturing the rolling body guide cage involves joining at least two flat material ring segments in succession in the circumferential direction and forming the ring element with axial profiling in a subsequent forming step.
</summary>

* The system obtains latitude and longitude coordinates of a customer service location using a global satellite positioning system.
* The system generates driving directions between two customer service locations using a mapping system and the obtained coordinates.

<summary>
* The system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields comprises two real triaxial magnetic field sensors, three pairs of compensation coils, and a control unit.
* The control unit receives the six output signals of the two real magnetic field sensors via six inputs.
* The output signals of the two magnetic field sensors are represented by a three-dimensional vector for each sensor.
* These two vectors are combined to a six-dimensional vector, i.e. a 6×1 matrix.
* The averaging over the output signals of the two real sensors is described by a matrix multiplication.
* The output signals of the virtual sensor are used as an input for independent control loops operating in parallel.
* The control loops have control algorithms transforming the virtual input signals V into changed signals {circumflex over (V)}.
* The matrix {circumflex over (V)} is multiplied by a 6×6 matrix L to obtain control signals for the six coils.
* The algorithm used by the control system is described as O=L·Ω(M·S).
* The system can compensate both homogeneous and inhomogeneous magnetic fields.
</summary>

* The invention relates to a method for investigating a sample derived from a biological source using CARS microscopy, where a resonance signal generated by coherent anti-Stokes Raman scattering is sensed in image-producing fashion.
* The method comprises furnishing at least one resonance site by means of a bioorthogonal reaction of an intrinsic chemical structure of the sample with at least one reaction partner.

<summary>
* The invention provides a system for assessing radiation therapy segmentations.
* It compares two segmentations of the same structure from different sources.
* The segmentations are converted to volume models and compared.
* Common, missing, and extra volume elements are identified and measured.
* A metric method is used to output a measure of conformance between the segmentations.
* The metric method can be customized by the user.
* The system provides visual and quantitative outputs for comparison.
* It can be used for training, evaluation, and quality assurance purposes.
* The output can also indicate if a new treatment plan is needed.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to accelerating the execution of floating point operations in a data processing system.
* The focus is on improving the effective subtraction operation, which is more complex and time-consuming than addition due to the need for aligning fractions and normalizing the result.
* The invention divides the effective subtraction operation into two procedures based on the absolute value of the difference between the arguments of the exponents of the two operands (ABS{DELTA(E)}).
* When ABS{DELTA(E)} is less than or equal to 1, the alignment of fractions and subtraction can be performed simultaneously, reducing the number of steps.
* When ABS{DELTA(E)} is greater than 1, the subtraction operation can be performed to ensure a positive result, and the normalization step can be simplified.
* The invention also introduces a technique using a difference between a subset of signals of the operand exponent arguments (TDELTA(E)) to accelerate the effective subtraction operation.
* The subset difference is used to begin subtraction of differences between operand fractions (or fractional portions thereof) before the complete difference between the exponent arguments is available.
</summary>

• The invention is a method and system for tracking specimens acquired from patients in a medical facility.
• A patient wears an ID band with a unique patient barcode number.
• An order to draw a specimen from the patient is entered into a computer, generating a unique order barcode number.
• A blood drawer (specimen-taker) has a badge with a unique barcode number.
• Specimen vials have unique vial barcode numbers preapplied.
• A barcode reader inputs the patient, order, blood drawer, and vial barcode numbers into the computer.
• The computer stores these barcode numbers in a relational database data structure, ensuring the correct patient, order, blood drawer, and vial are linked.

• The invention is a voice-activated distance measuring device for golfers, using GPS technology to provide distance and other information.
• The device incorporates voice recognition technology to accept verbal commands from the user and voice synthesis technology to provide audible output.
• The device may be incorporated into an article of clothing, such as a hat or visor, or other portable device.
• The device uses bone conductance vibration sensors to pick up the user's voice clearly while rejecting external noise.
• The device may also accept verbal or other data input to predict golf course user golf strategy, club selection, rules and other golf player needs.
• The device may be used for other applications, such as hiking, surveying, hunting, and scuba diving, and may be expanded for use in any portable application.

<summary>
* The invention provides a system and method for checking design rules in mixed logic and memory circuits.
* It applies the right set of rules to the right regions of the mask pattern data.
* Customized design rules are based on modifying standard logic rules to reflect memory needs.
* A customized design rule is created for each different type of region on the chip.
* The customized design rule is based on pushing more liberal parameters onto stricter parameters in the standard logic rules.
* The results are categorized in different categories in accordance with where they occur.
* The invention helps detect and classify mistakes or modifications made to standardized foundry bit cell designs.
</summary>

• **Waveguide Holograms (WGHs) as Illuminators**: Thin substrate waveguides optically coupled to a coherent light source, such as a laser, can be used to provide controlled illumination for objects like holograms and spatial light modulators (SLMs).
• **Advantages**: WGHs offer high diffraction efficiencies, compact size, and reduced stray light compared to conventional lens systems.
• **Challenges**: Alignment sensitivity, illumination depletion, two-sided diffraction, and light dispersion are potential issues that need to be addressed.
• **Solutions**: Attaching the light source to the waveguide, recording holograms non-uniformly, absorbing or reflecting one-sided diffraction, and using polarization modulation for SLMs can help mitigate these challenges.
• **Recording Systems**: Two basic architectures were used to record WGH gratings: a modified conventional holographic recording system and a system using a prism coupler for more stringent requirements.
• **Applications**: WGHs can be used to illuminate SLMs with white light or coherent laser light, enabling 3-D holographic image reconstruction.

* The invention provides a method and apparatus for non-destructive testing of dynamoelectric machine rotors, specifically squirrel cage rotors for induction motors.
* The test apparatus comprises a test head that magnetizes the rotor using an alternating current and senses the resulting voltage and current to calculate resistance and reactance.
* The test head also includes a skew pick-up coil to sense the effective electrical skew of the rotor.
* The apparatus automatically performs the test, processes the data, and provides pass/fail determinations based on pre-set threshold values.

* **Securing a Computing Device:**
	+ Grant access to native resources of an operating system to a managed library after validating its digital certificate.
	+ Deny access to native resources of the operating system to a managed application that lacks a digital certificate authorizing access through a managed library.
* **Protecting a Closed Computing Device:**
	+ Receive a request from a managed application to access a native system resource through a managed library.
	+ Authorize the request by a manager that includes information identifying managed libraries the application is authorized to access.
	+ Authorize the request to access the native system resource by the managed library, using information from its digital certificate.
	+ Send a request to access the native system resource to a runtime host effectuated by native instructions.
	+ Access the native system resource by the runtime host.
* **Publishing Videogames Configured to Execute on a Mobile Device:**
	+ Receive a package from a networked computer system.
	+ Identify an executable in the package.
	+ Verify managed metadata associated with the executable, including inspecting it at runtime to ensure type safe code.
	+ Transmit the verified package to a community feedback server for peer review.

* The identification card comprises a core layer of silica-filled polyolefin with a first side and a second side.
* At least one antenna is fixed to the first side of the core layer, and at least one computer chip is electrically connected to the antenna.
* The core layer is bonded to a bottom sheet of silica-filled polyolefin using an adhesive layer, with the antenna and chip enveloped between the core and bottom sheet.

<summary>
* The invention provides a method for implementing a queue, specifically a FIFO-type queue, in a memory, particularly a functional memory where updates are made by copying the path from the root to the point of updating.
* The queue is implemented using a tree-shaped data structure where nodes have a maximum size.
* Additions to the queue are directed to the first non-full node, seen from below, on the first edge of the data structure.
* Deletions from the queue are directed to a leaf node on the opposite edge of the tree.
* The tree-shaped data structure is maintained in such a way that the leaf nodes remain at the same hierarchy level.
* When a non-full node is not present, new nodes are created to keep the leaf nodes at the same hierarchy level.
* The time and space required for each update are logarithmically dependent on the length of the queue.
* The node to be updated is easy to access by following the edge of the tree until a leaf node is found.
* In a preferred embodiment, the data structure comprises a separate header node with three elements, each of which may contain a pointer to a separate node constituting the end, the tree-shaped structure, and the beginning of the queue, respectively.
* In this embodiment, additions are made first to the node constituting the end, and only thereafter to the tree-shaped structure, and deletions are made first from the tree-shaped structure, and only thereafter from the node constituting the beginning.
</summary>

* The invention provides methods to build embedded EPROM devices using existing IC manufacture technologies, including DRAM technology for redundancy circuits and standard logic technologies.
* The EPROM devices use DRAM storage capacitors as coupling capacitors or utilize transistor property changes under stress conditions to store data, reducing manufacturing complexity and cost.

• The invention provides a method for determining feedback gain in feedback control systems.
• The method involves provisionally determining a feedback gain value, executing feedback control using this value, detecting an error between a designated value and an actual value of the subject of control, calculating an evaluation value based on the error, and repeating these steps with different feedback gain values.
• The optimum feedback gain value is then calculated based on the relation between the feedback gain values and the corresponding evaluation values.
• In the case of determining the proportional gain, the evaluation value is the ratio between the length of a curve obtained by plotting the error against time and the length of the time axis, and the optimum value is the one that minimizes this ratio.
• For the integral gain, the evaluation value is obtained by integrating the error, and the optimum value is the one that makes this integral closest to zero.
• For the differential gain, the evaluation value is obtained by integrating the absolute value of the error, and the optimum value is the one that makes this integral closest to zero.
• The method can be applied to various feedback control systems, including those used in automatic guidance vehicles.

• The zoom lens of the invention comprises five lens units, with the fourth and fifth units having specific conditions to achieve a high relative aperture and good optical performance throughout the zooming range.
• The fourth lens unit has a positive lens with a rear surface of strong curvature, and the fifth lens unit has six lenses with specific powers and arrangements to correct aberrations.
• The conditions for the fourth and fifth lens units are:
  - 0.7 < |R.sub.4,2 /F.sub.4 | < 0.85
  - 1.05 < |f.sub.5,2 /F.sub.5 | < 1.5
  - 0.6 < |f.sub.5,4 /f.sub.5,5 | < 1.5
  - 50 < (ν.sub.5,1 + ν.sub.5,6)/2 < 59
• The total length of the lens system is reduced to as short as L=9.13φ A to 9.19φ A, making it suited for photographic cameras or video cameras.

<summary>
* The invention provides a method and device for detecting elementary particles that enables both the measurement of individual particles and the integration of a plurality of particles.
* The method involves generating a charge pulse in a detector when a particle passes through it, converting the charge pulse into an electric signal, and amplifying the signal.
* The device includes a detector for generating a charge pulse, an amplification device for converting the charge pulse into an electric signal, and optionally a display and/or recording device.
* The device includes a first, fast amplifier for amplifying individual signals and a second, slow amplifier for integrating signals.
* The method involves discharging the charge pulse from the detector on the low-voltage side to improve the signal/noise ratio and enable the detection of small-size signals.
* The method involves separating signals as a function of their rate by using a capacitor or high-pass element preceding the first amplifier and an inductive element or low-pass element preceding the second amplifier.
* The method involves amplifying signals in the different amplifiers at overlapping rates to enable a check and calibration within the overlapping range.
* The device includes a support capacitor for compensating for the discharge of the detector and maintaining its functionality even at high ionization rates.
</summary>

• The invention relates to an automatic spin checking apparatus for driven disc assemblies used in friction clutches.
• The apparatus consists of a rigid test enclosure with a stationary left ring and a movable right ring.
• A driven disc assembly is mounted on a splined hub located between the two rings.
• A servo motor moves the right ring towards the left ring to frictionally engage the driven disc assembly.
• A torque motor exerts a predetermined torque on the driven disc assembly to rotate it against the frictional force.
• The right ring is gradually moved away from the left ring to reduce the frictional force.
• When the driven disc assembly begins to rotate, the distance between the rings is measured.
• The difference between the initial and final distances is compared to a standard value to determine warpage.
• The apparatus automatically determines if the driven disc assembly is within specified tolerances and provides external indications to the operator.

• The present invention relates to face age-estimation methods, systems, and software.
• Face age-estimation is a challenging task due to large variations in human faces and aging mechanisms.
• The invention uses a contourlet appearance model (CAM) algorithm to extract unique features from images.
• A CAM combines shape variation and texture variation to represent aging faces.
• The invention uses support vector regression (SVR) to construct two differently-calibrated aging functions.
• The invention uses support vector machines (SVMs) to build an age classifier that distinguishes between youths and adults.
• The invention uses the age classifier to determine which aging function to use for a given face.
• The invention generates an estimated age using the appropriate aging function.
• The invention may provide estimated ages in the form of a single age or age indicator, or a set of ages with corresponding confidence factors.

• The invention describes a matrix display device that merges two images, one with higher definition and the other with lower definition.
• The matrix is organized in a mosaic of identical arrangements, each containing a predetermined number of pixels.
• In each arrangement, a first plurality of pixels is dedicated to displaying the first image, while one or more other pixels are dedicated to the second image.
• The matrix display device produces the merged display of the first and second images, with the second image being redimensioned by scaling means if necessary.
• In one embodiment, each arrangement consists of a square of four pixels, with three pixels displaying the first image and one pixel displaying the second image.
• In another embodiment, each arrangement also consists of a square of four pixels, but with two pixels displaying the first image and the remaining two pixels displaying the second image.

• The mobile identification transmitter for activating a motor vehicle's security system has a housing with a receptacle for a removable payment element.
• The transmitter can be set to a normal state (payment element inserted) or a secure state (payment element removed), with communication with the security system possible in both states.
• In the secure state, a closure protects and seals the receptacle, preventing moisture and dirt from entering.
• The payment element can communicate with a payment system for cashless transactions, with its own communication means or sharing the transmitter's communication means.
• The closure can be a dummy plug attached to a cable, a pivoting cap, or a sliding cover, ensuring the contact elements in the receptacle are protected from the external environment.

• The disclosed system addresses issues with inconsistent image quality after long periods of inactivity in imaging devices.
